title: The Field of Repetition
description: Learn to use for loops to automate movement and repeat actions efficiently.

phases.title: A New Task
phases.description: Meet the farmer and learn about repeating actions

preDialogues.name: Farmer Joe
preDialogues.content: Hey Qubit! I heard you learned the basics from Lain. I need you to move across the field—about 5 steps to the right. Can you help?

preDialogues.name: Qubit
preDialogues.content: Five steps? That's a lot of move_right() commands to type...

preDialogues.name: Farmer Joe
preDialogues.content: Not if you use loops! Let me teach you a smarter way—the 'for loop.' It lets you repeat actions without typing the same thing over and over.

preDialogues.name: Farmer Joe
preDialogues.content: A for loop looks like this: for i in range(5): move_right(). This runs move_right() five times! The 'i' is just a counter variable.

preDialogues.name: Qubit
preDialogues.content: So instead of typing move_right() five times, I can just tell the computer to repeat it? That's genius!

preDialogues.name: Farmer Joe
preDialogues.content: Exactly! Now try writing your own for loop in the code editor. Type: for i in range(3):

objectives.description: Type the for loop syntax: for i in range(3):

postDialogues.name: Farmer Joe
postDialogues.content: Good start! Now you need to add the action inside the loop.

phases.title: Complete the Loop
phases.description: Add the movement action inside the loop

preDialogues.name: Farmer Joe
preDialogues.content: Inside the loop, you need to indent and add move_right(). In Python, indentation matters! Make sure move_right() is indented under the for line.

postDialogues.name: Qubit
postDialogues.content: Like this? for i in range(3): and then indented move_right()?

postDialogues.name: Farmer Joe
postDialogues.content: Perfect! Now click the play button to watch yourself move three times automatically!

preDialogues.name: Farmer Joe
preDialogues.content: Now click the play button to watch your loop in action!

objectives.description: Click the play button to execute your for loop

postDialogues.name: Qubit
postDialogues.content: Whoa! I moved three times without me typing it three times! This is amazing!

postDialogues.name: Farmer Joe
postDialogues.content: That's the power of loops! They save you tons of time when you need to repeat actions.

phases.title: Combining Loops with Movement
phases.description: Learn to combine loops with movement commands

preDialogues.name: Farmer Joe
preDialogues.content: Great! You've mastered basic loops. Now remember, you can use loops with any command—movement, planting, harvesting, you name it! Loops work with everything.

preDialogues.name: Qubit
preDialogues.content: So loops are like a superpower that works with any action? That's awesome!

postDialogues.name: Farmer Joe
postDialogues.content: You've got the basics down! Loops are one of the most powerful tools in programming.

preDialogues.name: Farmer Joe
preDialogues.content: You've got the hang of for loops! You can use them to repeat any action—moving, planting, harvesting, you name it. With loops, automation just got a whole lot easier!

preDialogues.name: Qubit
preDialogues.content: Thanks Farmer Joe! I can't wait to use loops for the next chore. This coding stuff is really powerful!
